name: Hotel Nabucco

reviews.text: This hotel is quite a way out of the tourist centre of Prague with only average transport links (especially on weekends). The hotel is located in a run-down commercial area and at night is downright scary to get to - very dark and creepy.
reviews.title: Too far out

reviews.text: Once inside the hotel is moderate but certainly not 4 stars. The saving grace is the rooms themselves which are spacious and comfortable with lovely renovated bathrooms. Unfotunately I was woken all through the night by trains on the adjacent railway tracks and then by the sun streaming through the insufficient curtains. Breakfast was mediocre but most of the good choices had run out and were not replaced by halfway through the service period.
reviews.title: Umh!!!

reviews.text: All in all this was a disappointing experience and I wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, with a couple of caveats
Dreadful hotel!
reviews.text: The receptionists were always friendly & helpful but the owners appeared to sit in the lobby 24/7 smoking & watching Italian T.V. and rarely acknowledged the guests. We had a room on the side of the railway so had to buy ear plugs to try to blot out the sound of the continuous hooting & tooting of the trains as they left the station. The room was adequate for resting our weary bodies after a long day sightseeing but a tea/coffee machine would have been greatly appreciated(we believed there would be one). Trams are close by but the centre is much further than was suggested on the hotels web site. The dining room was pleasant,although a little sparsley decorated. the breakfast was good- continental style but the hot drinks came from a self service machine which is not the same as smelling freshly brewed coffeee. We also believed there was a restaurant in the hotel but that isn't the case,however there are several close by. Lots of renovation work was being carried out while we were there,our early evenings were punctuated by an abseiling painter outside our room window. The hotel has potential.....! The canopy above the front door shows four stars, the hotel is definately not four star which is what we really wanted.

description: Hotel Nabucco pays homage to the life and work of Giuseppe Verdi, extraodrinary Italian composer. Prague and its theatres are proud about his music that still sounds here. The Italian management pays attention especially to those that are arriving to Prague with an interest in classical music. The hotel is arranging sightseeing trips with the professional guides as well as theatre and concert tickets .At the present the hotel is under the complete restauration with the new vision. The whole space will be nicely lit up because of the ceilings in the main hall and dinning room will be from glass.The accommodation capacity of the hotel represent 4 suites, 20 double rooms and 3 single rooms. Each of the rooms is equiped with the telephone line, satelite TV and minibar. The bathrooms have got separated bath or showers and WC.Breakfast is served from 7,30 a.m. – 10,00a.m.. with a wide choice ofmeals of all the kinds and taste to satisfy the clients.The restaurant that is for a disposal of hotel clients offers the typical mediterranean cuisine with all the types of food.Hotel Nabucco has got the air-conditioning, bar service, sauna, massages, meeting-room for 40 persons, heated garage and closed parking.The accommodation in Nusle-Prague 4 is close to the city center – Wenceslas Square, approx. 5 minutesby tram No. 11 – 4 stops to the station Museum.Staff is fluent in English, German, Italian, Spanish, Czech and Russian.
